title: Pep Guardiola concerned about Manchester City’s lack of defensive cover as injury crisis continues
text:
Pep Guardiola admits he is concerned about Manchester City’s lack of defensive cover as his injury problems heightened yesterday with the news that Oleksandr Zinchenko and Rodri will be out until December.heightened yesterday with the news that Oleksandr Zinchenko and Rodri will be out until December.

The City manager also admitted that his plans could depend on England international John Stones and French full-back Benjamin Mendy shrugging off injury problems that have plagued them in recent months.

Zinchenko, injured during the last international break, underwent minor surgery in Spain this week, while Rodri pulled a hamstring during the midweek Champions League victory over Atalanta.

And with the best defender in Guardiola’s stable, Aymeric Laporte, out until well into the new year, the manager of the world’s wealthiest club admits he is worried about his lack of resources.

“When I’m thinking after the international break, November, ­December, January, February – yes I’m a little bit concerned because in a few positions we don’t have enough players,” Guardiola said.

“January window we are not going, well I think we are not going, to buy. The club didn’t introduce me to the players they thought could help us so, without that, it’s not ­going to happen.

“Our need is not just for six months, it’s for a long time and the important players will not be sold. We are going to stay all the season, I think, with all the players we have right now.”
description: Pep Guardiola admits he is concerned about Manchester City’s lack of defensive cover as his injury problems heightened yesterday with the news that Oleksandr Zinchenko and Rodri will be out until December.
